medical_history.chief_complaint: 69-year-old man with limb-girdle weakness and elevated CK levels.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Proximal lower limb weakness started at age 60 and progressively worsened, leading to the use of a cane. Proximal arm weakness, dysphagia, and rhinolalia developed subsequently. CK levels have been persistently elevated since age 56.
medical_history.family_history: Negative for neuromuscular disorders; no biological children.
